programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: As the saying goes, he who represents himself in court has a fool for a client. But in the case of Marc Benayer, who shot a man in his synagogue parking lot, was he a fool, or did his mental illness affect whether the jury would find him guilty?

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: As shocking as the brutal double murder committed by vampire obsessed teenaged Rod Ferrell was, nobody expected him to plead guilty at the start of his trial, leaving just the monumental question of how young is too young for the death penalty.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mark Dippolito couldn't believe it when the police told him his new bride Dalia had hired a hitman to have him killed; he was even more surprised when she claimed in court that it was his idea.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Cynthia Sommer's world was turned upside down when her 23-year-old husband Todd died; nearly five years later she was under arrest and accused of poisoning him.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: During direct examination of the victim's ex-girlfriend, the defense paints a picture for the jury that Travis Alexander was a bad boyfriend even before his relationship with defendant Jodi Arias.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Daniel Freeman meets Travis Alexander through activities associated with their Mormon faith; Desiree Freeman takes the stand to testify on the shaky relationship between Travis and the defendant, Jodi Arias.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.sub-title: Defense Introduces Their Computer Forensic Expert
programme.desc: Computer forensic expert Lonny Dworkin testifies that he examined two key pieces of evidence in the case; Dworkin walks the jury through his process of data collection extracted from both Jodi Arias' memory card and cell phone.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Police procedure and the conduct of an investigation is called into question by the defense team, possibly raising reasonable doubt; a computer forensic expert compares his data collection to that of what the police were able to retrieve.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.sub-title: Defendant Takes the Stand in Her Own Defense
programme.desc: After a pair of computer experts is called by the defense, the defendant takes the stand to tell her side of the story; Jodi Arias begins her testimony speaking about her childhood, which begins as idyllic but over time grows more troublesome.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: The defendant spends the earlier part of her court testimony talking about a high school relationship that happened while she was on-and-off with her first boyfriend, who she had been dating for several years.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.sub-title: High School Dropout Falls in Love
programme.desc: The defendant begins her young adult years as a high school dropout working in the restaurant business as a full-time service worker; it was at this time that she entered into her second intimate relationship, which she claims was physically abusive.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Jodi Arias tells the jury about her relationship with a man named Matt McCartney; within a span of a few years after high school, Jodi claims she was in about four different relationships with men; it was after these experiences that she met Travis.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors bring in a forensic accountant to show the money trail involved in the murder of Dan Markel; the state contended that Charlie Adelson orchestrated the plan and paid for it.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State's forensic accountant detailed payments made to Charlie Adelson's ex-girlfriend who had been convicted already in Dan Markel's death; Jurors learn about all the financial records of the Adelson Institute, the family's dental practice.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: A communication records analyst takes the stand; investigators retrieve data from cell phones and computers while they try to figure who is responsible for the murder of law professor Dan Markel.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Investigators put together the communications of the suspects in the days leading up to murder; they are trying to prove that there was a conspiracy to kill Dan Markel and that Charlie Adelson was the mastermind.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Tracking The Communication Lines Of The Co-Conspirators
programme.desc: The State calls in a communication records analyst who reviewed thousands of pages of cell phone records that tracked the co-conspirators accused in this case.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury's attention shifts from cell phone records to wire taps; more information is coming that investigators believe proves Charlie Adelson set up a plot to kill Dan Markel.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: A communication records analyst takes the stand; investigators retrieve data from cell phones and computers while they try to figure who is responsible for the murder of law professor Dan Markel.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors hear more testimony about the text messages linked to the death of law professor Dan Markel; police sergeant Chris Corbett continues his detailed testimony to the jury.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent testifies for the jury; he was involved in the sting operation, called a bump, that was done to get more information about the murder of law professor, Dan Markel.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: From Undercover Agents Back To The Lead Investigator
programme.desc: After undercover FBI agents testifies in Charlie Adelson's murder trial, the State shifts the focus to a forensic engineer; this witness has enhanced the secretly recorded conversations involving the defendant.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The FBI wiretap the cell phones of Charlie Adelson and the woman who was his girlfriend at the time of murder; agents intercept thousands of calls which the state claims to be proof that Charlie set up a conspiracy to end the life of the professor.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Listening To The Calls Of The Killers
programme.desc: The FBI sets up a sting operation to record communications involving Charlie Adelson, including those with his mother.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: For the four LAPD cops who beat Rodney King with batons, it may have been business as usual; but then the world learned that it had been captured on video, and those 81 seconds changed everything.
